subject: Re: RFP update
preview: Hi Amy,Sure, all good now on this one. https://staging-huntleyco.kinsta.cloud/catalogue-category/bed-linen/

full_threads.body:
Hi Amy,

Sure, all good now on this one. 
https://staging-huntleyco.kinsta.cloud/catalogue-category/bed-linen/

Thank you. Can you please also note "select in showroom" on the bed linen please.




Kind Regards

Amy Smith





AMY SMITH CEO - HUNTLEY + CO

E. amy@huntleyandco.com.au

P. 02 8310 2285 M. 0421 515 854 W. HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hi Amy,

We have added the 'select in showroom' tag on the appropriate products now and brought back the product images.

Hi Amy, 

Confirming all of the below are completed. We are just working on a script to make sure that if they access the RFP system from different devices that their quote will appear on both simultaneously. 

To answer your questions from below: 

Q. The pricing on my page looks at be double what it should be i.e $200 per week for a large rug. The current site is $50 so I believe it should be either $100 (short term) or $62.50 (long term) per week.
A. This is because I increased the percentage to 400% (4.0), you will see this in the video and can reduce it as needed.

Q. How do we decipher an RFP and main site client in the back end if they apply the same way?
A. If login to the backend of https://staging-huntleyco.kinsta.cloud you will see there are 2 menu items "Simple Quotes" and "Quotes". So they are easy to distinguish.

Looking good Mr M! Thank you. A few minor points and sorry to be brief…
  • There are 2 random hide rugs that are appearing in the rug section.
  • The pricing on my page looks at be double what it should be i.e $200 per week for a large rug. The current site is $50 so I believe it should be either $100 (short term) or $62.50 (long term) per week.
  • How do we decipher an RFP and main site client in the back end if they apply the same way?
  • Can we please add styled images to the parent categories as per dropbox please.
  • Can we please use generic drawings on all accessories, art, rugs, bed linen etc and have a band saying "select in showroom" as the main site currently has at the selection phase. We also need to remove the "quick view" button as there is nothing to view for these items.
  • I was able to submit a quote without ticking y/n to Risk Protection and Art Hanging.
  • The full delivery info should be at the bottom of the quote, the same as the main site. Perhaps just don't make the "notes" field mandatory.
  • Can the gallery be our insta feed?
Thank you very much and sorry for the brevity of my email. Kind Regards Amy Smith AMY SMITH CEO - HUNTLEY + CO E. amy@huntleyandco.com.au P. 02 8310 2285 M. 0421 515 854 W. HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hi Amy, 

As discussed, here is a link to the video: https://www.useloom.com/share/aa076acc1b284081ada6d1bca69c3599

And to test you can use these logins: 

Link: https://staging-huntleyco.kinsta.cloud/
Username: team@wolfiq.com.au
Pass: BpQvwxPi#PTX3)li2n!dTlMV

I suggest you use 2 different browsers, login with the test account on one and then login with your account on the other and adjust the % increases to see the pricing changes in real-time. Note, you need to login at: https://staging-huntleyco.kinsta.cloud/ not the live site.

Hi Amy, 

An update on the below: 

You will be able to see the menu/nav changes now. The other changes are too far off, we are just tidying them up before we push them to the server for you to review. I'll keep you updated on progress.

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hello,

It’s looking good. Thank you. I love the front end too. I’ll email you about that separately.

A few brief points:
The price seems to overlap the product image in a few cases. Can the price go into the blush banner where the product name is? It might look a bit neater there. Perhaps we may the font of the name and price a bit smaller so it all fits neatly.
The catalogue is called catalogue in one area and products in another. Can we please call it products in both.
The catalogue subheadings should be as follows:
Accessories, Wall Décor, Props, Lamps, Rugs
Accessories + Props
Cushions
Decorative Items – Small
Decorative Items – Medium
Decorative Items – Large
Faux Plant – Medium
Faux Plant – Large
Throw / Coverlette

Wall Decor

Art / Mirror – Medium
Art / Mirror – Large

Table
Small
Large
Sofa
Side Table
Sunlounge

When you hit the product tab from the main page it currently loads with everything. Can we have it load with the parent categories please? Perhaps once you click in the parent category there could be a “view all button” so you can see everything within a category too?
When a client starts “shopping” should some sort of pop up appear saying something along the lines of “Please add the items you would like to hire to your quote. Once complete, please submit your quote and Huntley + Co will contact you regarding availability of your selected products.” Or something along those lines.
The pickup date is not a required field (as in we don’t need the * there)
Should we also have a pop up when a client goes into the accessories and bed linen tab saying “Accessories, wall décor, props, lamps, rugs and bed linen can be added to your quote in order to obtain pricing however please note that these products must be selected in our showroom at Artarmon” or something like that.

Before we launch the RFP we need to adjust the pricing. The adjustment will be as follows:
An item that currently costs $100 per week will be:
X 2 i.e. $200 for short term hire (1 week)
X 1.25% $125 for long term hire (6 weeks, 4 paid + 2 free)
Are we able to still have a coupon field here as I may offer select client a coupon.

Also, I will need to reissue my current clients with a revised coupon to get them back to where they started. Can you please explain the implications of existing quotes in the system.

Last of all, when these changes push through I would also like to change the coupon so it only applies to the rental cost, not delivery, art hanging, risk protection or extensions.

Thank you.

Kind Regards
Amy Smith
AMY SMITH
CEO - HUNTLEY + CO <https://huntleyandco.com.au/>
E. AMY@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU <mailto:amy@huntleyandco.com.au>
P. 0421 515 854 <tel:0421%20515%20854>| 02 8310 2285 <tel:02%208310%202285>
W. HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU <https://huntleyandco.com.au/>

From: Heath Maguire <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
Date: Thursday, 7 March 2019 at 11:22 AM
To: Amy Smith <amy@huntleyandco.com.au <mailto:amy@huntleyandco.com.au>>
Subject: Re: RFP update

Hi Amy,

Confirming the RFP site is ready for your review, we have made all of the changes below.

A couple of notes for you:

Regarding the consolidated list in the room drop downs. We have reengineered this section to enable more flexibility. You can see this with the category BEDROOM FURNITURE > HEADBOARD. Please send through the structure that you want us to implement now that it’s possible.
Regarding the parent categories to become plurals. We can update this one the live site when we push the RFP there.
Please send through the copy for the welcome page and images for gallery (or I can use the ones from the recent dropbox uploads)

Here is the staging site location again:

Link: https://staging-huntleyco.kinsta.cloud/ <https://staging-huntleyco.kinsta.cloud/>
Username: team@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:team@wolfiq.com.au>
Pass: BpQvwxPi#PTX3)li2n!dTlMV

I will also have the revised public site visuals to you in the next few hours.

Thanks and speak soon,
HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU <https://wolfiq.com.au/>
E. heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au> | P. 1300 072 134 <tel:1300%20072%20134> | M. 0415 162 271 <tel:0415%20162%20271>
<https://wolfiq.com.au/>


> On 19 Feb 2019, at 2:34 pm, Amy Smith <amy@huntleyandco.com.au <mailto:amy@huntleyandco.com.au>> wrote:
>
> Hi Heath,
>
> I’m sorry for the delay in getting back to you on this. I’ve had a good play around, here is my feedback:
> Can we change the name from catalogue to products. We are worried that catalogue sounds too static. Thoughts?
> I would like to consolidate the list in the room drop downs. For example, instead of having single headboard, double headboard, queen headboard etc it would simply say “headboard”. The same for beds, dining tables, sofas, etc etc. Basically that drop down list would be very simplified. I know that is different to how things are set up at the moment. It would mean that there is a sub folder for certain categories between the parent and the child. Too complicated or ok?
> When you are looking at the child category I think we need an “add to cart button”. Would it be possible to make the “read more” button a pop up (like quick view currently is) and remove “quick view”? I’d love to do this for the main site too please.
> Can we please change the words on each of the parent categories to plural i.e. sofas, bedside tables etc etc so that it is clear we have more than one of each item. I’d love to do this for the main site too please.
> When you are in the child item and you increase the quantity should the price per week change? If we can’t do that should we say “price per week per items)
> I think we need all of the access and deliver info on this page (the same as the main site)
> The delivery costs in the T’s + C’s are still the old price brackets.
>
> I will work on the copy for the welcome page and send you the images for the gallery.
>
> There is one other aspect I would like to discuss around the different user profiles. Can you please call me when you are free to discuss.
>
> Can you please also confirm what the cost is for this site.
>
> Thank you.
>
> Kind Regards
> Amy Smith
>
>
> AMY SMITH
> CEO - HUNTLEY + CO <https://huntleyandco.com.au/>
